comments:
Build ID: 20070421

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Open the simple.cpp file in the project
2. Look up Type Hierarchy on MyClass
3. The Type Hierarchy comes up, but also an Error Dialog (see stack traces below)

More information:

This error log results:

eclipse.buildId=unknown
java.version=1.5.0_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Framework arguments:  -product org.eclipse.platform.ide -pdelaunch
Command-line arguments:  -product org.eclipse.platform.ide -data C:\workspace\CarbideTest-joey-cdtindexer -dev file:C:/Workspaces/eclipse-3.3/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.pde.core/Carbide/dev.properties -pdelaunch -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

Error
Thu Apr 26 07:35:04 CDT 2007
An internal error occurred during: "Open Type Hierarchy".

java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.index.composite.cpp.CompositeCPPFunctionTemplate
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.index.composite.cpp.CompositeCPPClassType.getDeclaredMethods(CompositeCPPClassType.java:95)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.typehierarchy.THGraph.addMembers(THGraph.java:272)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.typehierarchy.THGraph.addSuperClasses(THGraph.java:166)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.typehierarchy.THHierarchyModel.onComputeGraph(THHierarchyModel.java:156)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.typehierarchy.THHierarchyModel$BackgroundJob.run(THHierarchyModel.java:45)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

Created an attachment (id=65018)
simple project with the offending types

The creation of CompositeCPPMethodTemplate and CompositeCPPConstructorTemplate classes should fix this.  Currently, CPPCompositesFactory.getCompositeBinding(...) creates CompositeCPPFunctionTemplates for method and constructor templates.

Created an attachment (id=65201)
patch applied to HEAD

thanks Ed, Bryan :)

I've added a regression test and applied the suggested fix:
   org.eclipse.cdt.internal.index.tests.IndexCPPBindingResolutionBugs.test184216()
